title: Chord: Minor 7th in E (Shape: G)
content:
# About the Minor 7th Chord in E (Shape: G)

The Minor 7th chord is a 4-note chord built using the root (1st), minor third (b3), perfect fifth (5th), and minor seventh (b7) intervals. In the case of E Minor 7th, the notes are E (root), G (minor third), B (perfect fifth), and D (minor seventh). The chord is commonly abbreviated as Em7.

## Notes and Intervals
- E (Root)
- G (Minor Third)
- B (Perfect Fifth)
- D (Minor Seventh)

## Musical Flavor and Genre Use
The E Minor 7th chord has a smooth and jazzy sound. It is often used in jazz, blues, funk, and other genres where a soulful and mellow vibe is desired. This chord adds a touch of sophistication and emotion to a musical piece.

## Songs that Use the E Minor 7th Chord
1. "Autumn Leaves" - This jazz standard features the E Minor 7th chord in various progressions throughout the song.
2. "Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra - This classic tune includes the E Minor 7th chord in the chord progression.
3. "Hit the Road Jack" by Ray Charles - The E Minor 7th chord is prominent in this bluesy hit song.

These songs showcase the versatility and emotional depth that the E Minor 7th chord can bring to music.
